result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph C. Pierce Sr

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 8, 2022 at 11:30 am.

04:15 PM All appeared through Zoom platform. Defendant Joseph C. Pierce Sr in court.  Attorney Bernardo Cueto in court for Joseph C. Pierce Sr.  Prosecuting attorney Melissa S. Inlow in court for the State of Wisconsin. State is in compliance with Victim Rights Law.
Status conference scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on October 24, 2022 at 04:15 pm.

1:31 PM All appeared through Zoom platform. Defendant Joseph C. Pierce Sr appeared by video from the Clark County Jail.  Attorney Bernardo Cueto appeared by video for Joseph C. Pierce Sr.  Prosecuting attorney Melissa S. Inlow appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defense request another status for further negotiations.
Status conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 04:15 pm.

11:28 AM Prosecuting attorney Ellen Anderson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joseph C. Pierce Sr appeared by video from the Clark County Jail.  Attorney Bernardo Cueto appeared by video for Joseph C. Pierce Sr. 
Attorney Cueto comments regarding defendant wanting to speak his own legal arguments. 
Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint. Waived time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
Court sets pretrial conference and status.
Pre-trial conference on July 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Status conference on August 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on July 6, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.

1:32 PM All appeared through Zoom platform. Defendant Joseph C. Pierce Sr in court, in custody from Clark County Jail.  Attorney Ellen Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant objects to the proceedings. SPD has not assigned an attorney as of todays date. Court orders an appointment of counsel per county's expense.
Status Conference hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

02:00 PM Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Joseph C. Pierce appeared, pro se by video from Clark County Jail.  SPD still looking for an attorney.  Will set for one more status and if no one assigned, the Court will assign an attorney.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Application was done per Judge Brunette.
records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on June 14, 2022 at 08:55 am.

09:15 AM Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Joseph C. Pierce appeared, pro se by video from Clark County Jail.  Defendant did not make a request to the Public Defender and was told he needed to contact them on this case.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 08:55 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 3, 2022 at 09:15 am.

09:31 AM Attorney Melissa S. Inlow appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Joseph C. Pierce appeared, pro se by video from Clark County Jail.  Has not contacted the Public Defender on this case.  He said he did not know about this case.    Defendant advised of right to an attorney.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Joseph C. Pierce appeared, pro se by video from Clark County Jail.   He wants an attorney.   He wants a different Judge and a different attorney on this case and on his other case with Judge Diehn.  Attorney Robert Thorson appeared for this case but he is on assigned to this caxse.  He needs to reapply at the PD case.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Initial appearance on March 1, 2022 at 03:05 pm.

The defendant shall have no contact with victims B.O. and victims family of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way, their family members, residences or where temporarily residing.  No pornography.  No Internet or using or owning any equipment capable of Internet conductivity, exception would be if with Attorney. No contact with any minors what so ever.

04:02 PM Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Joseph C. Pierce appeared, pro se from the Clark County Jail. Attorney Thorson a special appearance.  Defendant does not acknowledged receipt of complaint.  Defendant advised of right to an attorney.  Initial appearance scheduled for March 1, 2022 at 03:05 pm.
